channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: Bitcoin price risk? US debt deal to trigger $1T liquidity crunch, analyst warns
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Yashu Gola
item.description: Bitcoin price could drop to $20,000 in Q3 amid mounting worries about a potential cash liquidity crisis led by the U.S. Treasury Department.

item.title: Stablecoin survival: Navigating the future amid global de-dollarization
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Luke Huigsloot
item.description: The stablecoins with the largest market cap are pegged to the U.S. dollar, so what risk does de-dollarization pose to stablecoin users?

item.title: NFTs in the academy: Fighting fake credentials and unfair wages
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: Pepperdine University professor Beau Brannan believes that NFTs could allow verification for individual courses and give more insight into college degrees.

item.title: Web3 zombie apocalypse is here: Last Remains joins Cointelegraph Accelerator
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Cointelegraph
item.description: Backed by industry heavyweights; this new blockchain game aims to get a foothold in the competitive arena.

item.title: Bitcoin price retests key support as Fed rate hike fears steal $27K
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Bitcoin bulls fail to stem fresh losses, with BTC price abandoning prior strength and opportunistic whales manipulating the arena with liquidity.

item.title: Apple bans ChatGPT use for employees over fears of data leaks
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: An internal document from the tech giant said that while it develops its own AI technology, employee usage of outside AI chatbots will be restricted.

item.title: Texas proof-of-reserve bill passes through the Senate
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By David Attlee
item.description: The legislation would oblige exchanges to maintain reserves “in an amount sufficient to fulfill all obligations to customers.”

item.title: Australian stock exchange officially abandons blockchain plans: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Amaka Nwaokocha
item.description: ASX has abandoned its software rebuild using blockchain technology to explore more conventional options.

item.title: Crypto should become a regular part of TradFi within 5-10 years: Exchange CEO
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ciaran Lyons
item.description: Bittrex Global CEO Oliver Linch believes crypto conferences won’t exist in five to 10 years — because crypto will become just a part of traditional finance.

item.title: Australian exchanges dispel debanking fears amid Binance saga, but risks loom
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: Australian crypto exchanges report no problems with their payment providers, but the lack of local laws means more debanking incidents can’t be ruled out.

item.title: Stablecoin issuers have spent over $1.3M lobbying Congress since 2022
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Martin Young
item.description: Tether and Circle have been leading lobbying efforts among stablecoin issuers as they push for legislation and regulations for stablecoins.

item.title: OpenAI launches official ChatGPT app for iOS, Android coming ‘soon’
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Mitchelhill
item.description: While it is currently only available in the United States, a full global rollout could see more than a billion users access to the official app on iOS.

item.title: Blockchain arms race risks being won by ‘adversarial nations’ — US crypto lobby group
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Martin Young
item.description: The Chamber of Digital Commerce has urged Congress to set up a Digital Asset and Blockchain Technology Solarium Commission to develop crypto regulation.

item.title: Coin Cafe ordered to repay $4.3M in fees that ‘wiped out’ investors’ Bitcoin accounts
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ciaran Lyons
item.category: New York Department of Financial Services
item.description: The platform was charging investors “exorbitant and undisclosed fees," with one user charged a total of $51,000 over just 13 months, according to the New York attorney general.

item.title: FTX pursues $244M clawback from ‘wildly inflated’ Embed acquisition deal
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Mitchelhill
item.description: FTX lawyers want to claw back $243.7 million from Embed insiders and executives, claiming its former leadership paid a “wildly inflated” price for the stock-trading platform.

item.title: Binance Australia partner hints at rising ‘scams’ after debanking exchange
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: Cuscal, the company that handles the Australian dollar on- and off-ramping for the exchange, declined to comment specifically on why it decided to pull support for Binance Australia.

item.title: Ripple, Visa join HK CBDC pilot, Huobi accusations, GameFi token up 300%: Asia Express
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: Mastercard and Visa join Hong Kong’s CBDC pilot, new installment in Justin Sun’s Huobi soap opera, and a GameFi token pumps on no news.

item.title: I run a Ledger competitor — but I support them in blow-up over keys
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ouriel Ohayon
item.description: Ledger’s latest update — aimed at making private seed phrases on its wallets recoverable — was simply an attempt to innovate and improve user security.

item.title: IMF sees room for eNaira improvement in first year assessment
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: The world’s second-ever CBDC has yet to reach 1% of Nigeria’s population, according to the IMF assessment.

item.title: Bitcoin defense lawyer says Craig Wright lawsuit could harm open source software
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tristan Greene
item.description: The Bitcoin Defense Legal Fund’s chief legal officer spoke out against an “extraordinarily dangerous” lawsuit initiated by Craig Wright, a person who claims to be Bitcoin creator Satoshi Nakamoto.

item.title: Ledger clarifies how its firmware works after deleted tweet controversy
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: Developers say third-party apps can’t access Ledger users’ keys without the device owner’s consent.

item.title: Singaporean family office to set up digital bank in Bahrain
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: Whampoa Group started its digital asset arm in 2021 and has invested in a $500 million Binance Labs fund along with TikTok parent ByteDance.

item.title: Crypto adoption is booming, but not in the US or Europe — Bitcoin Builders 2023
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: At the Bitcoin Builders Conference, Daniel Fogg from IOV Labs spoke with Cointelegraph about how emerging markets are shaping the future of the crypto space.

item.title: Coinbase launches zero trading fee subscription service
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Judith BannermanQuist
item.description: Coinbase’s new subscription service, “Coinbase One," is expected to roll out across 35 countries in the near future.

item.title: Bitcoin Miami panel rejects ‘fight’ rhetoric against regulators
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tristan Greene
item.description: Panelists at a discussion on “Fighting the Anti-Crypto Army” sought to dismiss the idea that working with lawmakers to regulate crypto should be framed as a fight.

item.title: Bitcoin, gold and the debt ceiling — Does something have to give?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: Traders are still tiptoeing around markets, as multiple risk events remain at the forefront, but BTC margin and futures markets are starting to favor a bullish breakout.

item.title: US House stablecoin hearing focuses on competing bills for regulation
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: The answer to the question of what level stablecoin issuers are regulated on “need not be binary,” one witness said.

item.title: Blockchain developers launch $50M fund to increase Wormhole adoption
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: Wormhole is a cross-chain messaging protocol often used to transfer assets from one blockchain to another.

item.title: Former CFO indicted for diverting $35M to cryptocurrency venture
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Judith BannermanQuist
item.category: The U.S. District Court in Seattle has indicted Nevin Shetty on charges of wire fraud
and is expected to be arraigned on May 25
item.description: In the event of a conviction for wire fraud, Nevin Shetty could face up to 20 years in prison.

item.title: Hyperbitcoinization coming, says Bitcoin OG as ‘wholecoiners’ hit 1 million
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: 1 million Bitcoin wallets now have a balance of 1 BTC or more, but the real magic is yet to come, says Adam Back.
